N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 29.10 - Indemnification

State Regulations

The appropriate fiscal officer of the county shall
indemnify and save harmless the commissioner (State of New York) from and
against any and all liability, damage, expense, cause of action, suits, claims, penalties or judgments arising from the administration and collection of the
tax as required by this agreement. The appropriate fiscal officer of the county
shall, at the county's cost and expense, defend any and all suits and actions
which may be brought against the commissioner, or in which the commissioner may
be impleaded with others, arising from the administration and collection of the
tax. In the event of the failure of the appropriate fiscal officer of the
county to do so, the commissioner may, at the cost and expense of the
appropriate fiscal officer of the county, and upon prior written notice to the
appropriate fiscal officer of the county, defend any and all such suits or
actions, and the appropriate fiscal officer of the county shall satisfy, pay
and discharge any and all judgments that may be recovered against the
commissioner in any such suits or actions which may be brought against the
commissioner or in which the commissioner may be impleaded with others. In the
event the appropriate fiscal officer of the county fails to pay the amount or
amounts for which the commissioner shall become liable, the commissioner may
pay the same, and the amount or amounts so paid, with any interest and costs
that may be due thereon, shall be reimbursed to the commissioner from the
vehicle use tax proceeds received by the commissioner, and shall be deducted
from any quarterly payment or payments to be made to the appropriate fiscal
officer of the county in accordance with this agreement. Notes
